name: Melanoma Pharynx Other T
title: Clinical and Pathological T
notes:
**Note 1:**  TNM does not include a Tis category for melanomas of the upper aerodigestive sites (head and neck). Tis is mapped to NA and TNM stage group is derived as NA.

**Note 2:**  Mucosal melanomas are aggressive tumors, therefore T1 and T2 are omitted as are Stages I and II.

**Note 3:**  Assign T3 for localized tumor when no other information is available or for extension involving the mucosa only of adjacent sites.

**Note 4:**  Assign T4a or T4b for extension involving the deeper tissues of the primary or adjacent sites.
footnotes:
\*TX is not defined in AJCC 7th edition
\**T0 is not defined in AJCC 7th edition
rows:
Unknown; extension not stated

Tumor limited to the epithelium and/or submucosa (mucosal disease)

Tumor confined to mucosa of site of origin

Mucosa only of more than one region of pharynx involved:
    Oropharynx
    Nasopharynx
    Hypopharynx

Mucosa only of pharynx and oral cavity involved

Localized, NOS

Stated as T3

Note: T4 has subcategories of T4a and T4b. Assign T4 only when there is no information available to assign one of the subcategories

Stated as T4 [NOS]
Tumor invades deep soft tissue, cartilage, bone or overlying skin

Extension to adjacent structures 
Involvement of deep soft tissue or musculature or mucosal involvement of any structure in T3 
Involvement of any of  the structures in T3 WITH fixation


Stated as T4a

Tumor invades any of the following:
Brain
Dura
Skull base
Lower cranial nerves (IX, X, XI, XII)
Masticator space

Prevertebral space
Mediastinal structures

Contiguous extension:
    Carotid artery (encased)
    Mediastinal structures
   
Stated as T4b
